item.title: ðŸŽ‰ My second paper has finally been accepted!
item.description:
Excited to share that my second paper, “Chance-Constrained Trajectory Optimization for UAVs with Randomly Moving Obstacles”, has been accepted by IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems.

Submitted on Feb 21, 2025 to IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems.
Received major revision on Jun 10, and resubmitted on Jul 9, and accepted on Sep 23.

ðŸ‘‰ Read the article on IEEE Xplore

item.title: ðŸŽ‰ My first paper has finally been accepted!
item.description:
Excited to share that my first paper, “Two-sided Chance-constrained Penetration Trajectory Optimization for Unmanned Combat Aerial Vehicle”, has been accepted by the AIAA’s Journal of Aircraft!

Submitted on Jan 23, 2025 to Journal of Aircraft.
Received Major Revision on Jun 5, resubmitted on Jun 19, and accepted on Jun 25.

ðŸ‘‰ Read the article on AIAA ARC

item.title: Completed an industry-funded research project.
item.description: After a year of dedicated effort and multiple rounds of communication with the client, I successfully completed a project on the design of an offline scheduling algorithm for parallel tasks. I was responsible for over 90% of the design, implementation, testing, and documentation. I’m very glad to see the project concluded smoothly.

item.title: Enrolled at Xiâ€™an Jiaotong University.
item.description: With great anticipation, I have officially enrolled in the School of Mathematics and Statistics at Xiâ€™an Jiaotong University to pursue a Masterâ€™s degree in Applied Statistics. Under the supervision of Professor Jia Liu, my research will focus on trajectory optimization. I look forward to the next three years of academic growth, research exploration, and personal development.

item.title: Graduated with a Bachelor's degree.
item.description: I graduated today from the School of Mathematical Sciences at the University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, with a Bachelor of Science in Data Science and Big Data Technology. I am deeply grateful for the excellent education I received, the insightful professors I learned from, and the brilliant friends I met along the way. Though the mountains are high and the road long â€” we will meet again.
